Remarks: Abnormal pH may indicate contamination, adulteration, or spoilage.
Higher temperatures promote bacterial growth; check cooling/storage.
Low density may indicate adulteration with water.
Low fat may suggest poor feeding/adulteration; higher in buffalo milk.
Low SNF suggests watering or poor nutrition.
Represents Fat + SNF; low values may indicate dilution.
Acidity >0.18 indicates sour milk; low acidity may mean neutralization.
Low protein linked to poor feeding/health; high may affect processing.
Low lactose may signal mastitis/adulteration; high may be lab error.
High bacterial count suggests poor hygiene or storage.
High SCC may indicate mastitis and poor udder health.

NormalRange: Excellent: ≥ 5–6 hrs, Good: 3–4 hrs, Fair: 1–2 hrs, Poor: ≤ 30–60 min
Remarks: Indicates bacterial load through reduction time.
Measures bacterial activity; short times = high bacterial presence.
Abnormal tints indicate defects or contamination.
Rancid, sour, or medicinal odour indicates spoilage/defects.
Storage temperature guideline to prevent bacterial growth.
